channel.title: BBC News - Asia
channel.copyright: Copyright: (C) British Broadcasting Corporation, see http://news.bbc.co.uk/2/hi/help/rss/4498287.stm for terms and conditions of reuse.

item.title: Henan floods: 12 dead in Zhengzhou train and thousands evacuated in China
item.description: Passengers describe how they climbed onto chairs to keep their heads above the floodwaters.

item.title: Zhengzhou Henan: Chest-high flooding hits China trains and roads
item.description: Roads and subway stations have been submerged and one region recorded 40cm (15 inches) of rainfall.

item.title: Covid-19: India outrage over 'no oxygen shortage death data' claim
item.description: A minister's claim that no Covid deaths were reported from a lack of oxygen has sparked anger.

item.title: Covid: Anger as half of Australians in lockdown again
item.description: Three states enforce stay-at-home orders, fuelling criticism of Australia's slow vaccination rate.

item.title: Mucormycosis: India records more than 4,300 'black fungus' deaths
item.description: The normally rare infection has a 50% mortality rate and is hitting recovering Covid-19 patients.

item.title: Olympics: Tokyo 2020 chief does not rule out cancelling Games
item.description: Just days before the Games' opening ceremony, more athletes have tested positive for Covid.

item.title: The battle for Indonesia's Gold Island
item.description: There are fears that a mine will threaten Sangihe island's ancient forests and local water supply.

item.title: 2032 Games: Brisbane confirmed as Olympic and Paralympic host
item.description: Brisbane is confirmed as the host of the 2032 Olympic and Paralympic Games after approval at an IOC meeting in Tokyo

item.title: Nike trainer output at key factory hit by Covid outbreak
item.description: Nike could run out of its Vietnamese-made trainers because of a rise in Covid infections in the region.

item.title: China says Microsoft hacking accusations fabricated by US and allies
item.description: There are concerns that the attack on the tech giant suggests China's cyber-behaviour is escalating.

item.title: Eid al-Adha prayers continue as rockets fired in Afghanistan
item.description: Some of the worshippers in Kabul appeared frightened and unsure what to do when they heard multiple explosions.

item.title: Covid: Asia follows global shares slide amid recovery fears
item.description: Stocks in Asia follow Monday's falls, but shares in Europe make a brighter start on Tuesday.

item.title: Mandira Bedi: What Hindu scriptures say about women at cremations
item.description: Indian actress Mandira Bedi made news for doing her husband's last rites, generally a male preserve.

item.title: Tokyo 2020: Does Japan have Covid under control?
item.description: With the Olympics starting this on Friday, more and more Covid cases are being reported.

item.title: Tokyo Olympics: Athletes find new ways to train in lockdown
item.description: Participants in the upcoming Games have been going to unusual lengths to stay in shape under restrictions.

item.title: Covid: Ivermectin, milk among Indonesia's unproven 'cures'
item.description: As Indonesia sees a surge fuelled by the Delta variant, misleading health claims are spreading.

item.title: India farmers' protest: Living on a highway in protest
item.description: Seven months on, farmers are still striking against contentious new laws outside the national capital.

item.title: Covid: Is China's vaccine success waning in Asia?
item.description: Thailand and Indonesia's switch to other Covid jabs has raised questions about Chinese vaccines.
